page.title: 13BEEF HERD II.
page.content: Mastitis,an udder inflammation,and New Forest Disease,an eye infection.To stop horns growing,the "horn buds" are burnt out at about 1mth.old using a hot iron.Antibiotics stop infection. In winter the herd is under cover. The cows are fed on{Barley Meal,Sugar {Beet Pulp}and{straw.}The calves eat {Barley}and{Silage.}The farm grows its own Barley and grass for Silage. In spring,the herd is put out onto the pastures when the weather is warm and the land dried out.Quick-growing grass causes problems as it lacks Magnesium. Spraying the field with a mineral solution feeds the pasture for 10wks. The herdsman must also watch for other illnesses which may be due to soil bacteria,protein allergies and suckling problems which would spoil the development of the meat.
